title: Watch RuPaul's Drag Race UK season 3 final online from the UK and abroad
author: alice-marshall
summary: Who will be crowned and jingle our bells in season 3's final?
article: We've discovered the tops and the bottoms and each of our finalists have had their fair share of RuPeter badge wins (and sashes - hey, Kitty girl!), but who will be taking the title of RuPaul's season 3 queen? Find out and watch RuPaul's Drag Race season 3 final online for free in the UK and get streaming options abroad, too.

Mama Ru gave us not one, but two seasons of RuPaul's Drag Race UK this year as 12 drag queens sashayed onto the mainstage once again. But who will become the next Queen of Drag Race UK, and demonstrate the highest level of creativity, uniqueness, nerve, and talent? Well, we're about to find out now we're down to our three finalists.
Krystal Versace, RuPaul's youngest contestant at 19-years-old, goes up against comedy queen Kitty's Scott-Claus, and fairly new to the world of drag, Ella Vaday.

Challenged with delivering a festive jingle 'Hey Sis, It's Christmas', there will then be one final mainstage runway, too, where we're expecting the three queens to sleigh with their holiday inspired looks.
Ready, set, glow, queens! Here's how to watch RuPaul's Drag Race UK season 3 final online 100% for free in the UK, and options to stream abroad, too.

Don't Ru the day you booked a trip abroad when season 3's Drag Race UK final drops. Sure to be serving looks, you'll be faced with geo-restrictions when trying to access the likes of BBC iPlayer. However, there is a werk around.

The best VPN - otherwise known as a virtual private network - offers a simple solution. This piece of software alters your IP address to appear as though you're based in another country, allowing you to gain access to your preferred streaming platform, and watch episodes live or on-demand just like you would at home.
Three simple steps to using a VPN to watch RuPaul's Drag Race UK
1. Download and install a VPN - we recommend ExpressVPN
2. Connect to the relevant server location - launch the VPN app, click on 'choose location' and select the right location i.e. UK for iPlayer
3. Head to the chosen broadcaster's live stream - in this case, head to the BBC iPlayer
WOW Present Plus is the self-dubbed "official streamer of all things drag" and comes to us from World of Wonder, the production company behind RuPaul's Drag Race.

As such, it has an impressive catalogue of RuPaul shows - including the latest season 13 episodes - available to stream all over the world including in markets like India, South Africa, the UAE and many other countries. A full list of what's available and where can be found here.

It's a pretty niche offering but if drag shows are your thing, you'll find it also hosts the likes of UNHhhh, Untucked, and Transformations - all for the ultra-affordable price of just $3.99 a month. Best of all, there's a FREE 7-day trial on offer so you can sashay on over and check it out for yourself.
